Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: Verus Agama v0.5.7-4 is the latest version and should be used. v0.6.0-13 is an older version and is **not** the recommended version to use anymore.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Benj_pirate 
as Oink said 0.5.7-4 is the latest version and should be used.
```
5) Then import the old seed (compromised), in the Verus Agama wallet and activate KMD lite mode. Then send all the funds to the new KMD address created previously
```
this means to move your coins from an address created using the old Agama wallet to an address created using the new agama wallet.

Author: shak3nbak3#2279
Content: Noob question ‚Äì I'm trying to dump my private key in Ocean Wallet console, but my wallet is encrypted and it says Error: Please enter the wallet passphrase with walletpassphrase first. (code -13) where do I enter the passphrase

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @shak3nbak3 `walletpassphrase "<YOUR PASSPHRASE>" <seconds to decrypt wallet>`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so `walletpassphrase "myencryptionpassphrase" 60` will unlock the wallet for 1 minute, you can then do any rpc command that requires decryption for 1 minute

the wallet.dat file has to be backedup after every transaction

Author: Yu#7000
Content: what's the most stable wallet that stake KMD in your opinion?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: komodo daemon and using command line interface or komodo qt if you want a UI

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
And about staking and monthly reward, kmd does not stake technically: the wallet does not need to be online to earn sth. If you do one tx to yourself or another address once per month, you earn thd reward. It is unique to kmd (a kind of interest for active users).
In comparison, a smartchain with staking and pow mining (such as labs) have a part of pos blocks and a part of pow blocks. In this case, wallet of the staker must be online to be able to earn sth. @Yu
